title: Remembering the Battle of Boet Erasmus - an almighty punch-up, three reds and no backward steps taken
text:
Canada prepare to face South Africa in Kobe on Tuesday for the first time in the World Cup since an infamous night 24 years ago which came to be known as the Battle of Boet Erasmus. Forget the five red cards at this tournament; this was the dirtiest match in World Cup history.

Technically, it was the second Battle of Boet Erasmus after the Lions deployed the infamous '99' call against the Springboks in 1974. This was played in the same ferocious mean spirit that belied Port Elizabeth’s reputation as the “friendly city”.
